path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/QuillAudits/Magic Cube Smart Contract Audit Report - QuillAudits.pdf

findings.title: Unsecured approve function usage
findings.description: The standard ERC20 implementation contains a widely-known racing condition in its approve function, wherein a spender is able to witness the token owner broadcast a transaction altering their approval and quickly sign and broadcast a transaction using transferFrom to move the current approved amount from the owner’s balance to the spender.

findings.title: Renounce Ownership
findings.description: The renounceOwnership function is used in smart contracts to renounce ownership. Otherwise, if the contract's ownership has not been transferred previously, it will never have an Owner, which is risky.

findings.title: Floating Pragma
findings.description: Using a floating pragma version can introduce issues in the contract system.
